definition: topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: His works are "evening star" and "Untitled song" and so on.
sentences.chinese: 其作品有《黄昏的星》和《无题的歌》等。

sentences.english: They contributed a lot to the development of the art of Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 无题诗对诗歌艺术的发展贡献很大。

sentences.english: Only so can one grasp Li Shangyins connotation of thought better.
sentences.chinese: 这样才能更好地把握李商隐“无题”诗的思想内涵。

sentences.english: Untitled, on the other hand, reveals Zao's manipulation of playfulness over abstraction.
sentences.chinese: 《无题》则表现了赵无极进一步发展的抽象趣味。

sentences.english: I am sitting in the dusk, listening to loneliness weave an untitled tale.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在黄昏里，听寂寞编织一个无题的故事。

definition: to write a poem using another poem's rhymes
to search for the right word (of poet)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
abbr. for 七言律詩|七言律诗, verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines
reply to a poem in the same rhyme
understanding and enjoying (a work of art)
late at night/in the dead of night
